The euler angles are set to 0 degrees in all three axes, and the translation vector is also set to [0, 0, 0]. This will place the origin of the coordinate system at the base of the prism. Draw another arc with a start point at [0.03, 0.42], a mid point at [0.0088, 0.4112], and an end point at [0.0, 0.39]. 8. Finally, draw a line from the end point of the arc [0.0, 0.39] to the start point of the first arc [0, 0.03]. This will close the loop. After creating the loop, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 in all three dimensions using the sketch scale parameter. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.1995 towards the normal direction of the sketch and no opposite direction extrusion. The height of this intermediate part is 0.1995, the width is 0.1995, and the length is 0.5625. The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.</description>
